metadata.Title: CVE-2022-36319 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
When combining CSS properties for overflow and transform, the mouse cursorcould interact with different coordinates than displayed. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 102.1, Firefox ESR < 91.12, Firefox <103, Thunderbird < 102.1, and Thunderbird < 91.12.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-36319` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
